oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Poets and Prophets program - Jimmy Webb - 2017-04-29
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with and performances by singer/songwriter Jimmy Webb from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on April 29, 2017. Program hosted by Michael Gray.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jimmy Webb;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening comments in progress by Abi Tapia / (00:49) Introduction of previous Poets and Prophets attendees and introduction of Jimmy Webb by Michael Gray / (07:25) Performs By The Time I Get To Phoenix / (11:34) Opening comments by Jimmy / (11:55) Jimmy talks about the first time he remembers hearing of Glen Campbell and becoming interested in songwriting at 14 years of age / (15:19) Talks about the story behind the song By The Time I Get To Phoenix and how it got to Glen Campbell / (16:08) Tells story about President Bill Clinton during a fundraiser / (18:13) Talks about Johnny Rivers recording the song first and performs excerpt of the song The Poor Side Of Town / (19:14) Talks about Johnny Rivers and his help getting the song to Glen Campbell and the first time he heard Glen's recording of it on the radio / (20:55) Talks about the first time he met Glen Campbell and Glen's musical talents /

(26:40) Talks about the song Galveston and shows footage of Glen talking about and performing the song / (29:40) Jimmy talks about Glen's singing voice / (30:52) Jimmy tells story about writing Wichita Lineman / (32:30) Performs the song Wichita Lineman / (37:18) Jimmy talks about his early days playing piano and demonstrates the way his piano teacher taught him / (40:52) Writing his first song titled Someone Else / (41:38) Performs the song Someone Else / (44:18) Plays excerpt recording of Art Garfunkel singing Someone Else / (46:24) Talks about starting out with The Contessas and beginning to work for Motown Records and tells story about recording 53 demos of Rod McKuen's in one day / (51:28) Jimmy talks about wanting to be a songwriter and the dichotomy of the world he was in and the world he wanted to live in / (55:02) Turning down big money gigs in Las Vegas and playing coffee houses instead / (58:20) Talks about the song MacArthur Park /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Webb, Jimmy; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
